column4: can anyone think why my resolution is set correctly but the display is not taking up the whole LCD? if I change the refresh rate to 75 HZ it takes up the whole LCD but my LCD says out of range?
I'm assuming that the LCD is connected via a 15-pin VGA cable and not a DVI, correct?
yes.

1440x900 at 60Hz is the native res....Envision 19" Wide LCD....someone told me my BusID might be wrong and I did a grep command and got this, 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller....and my line is set to  BusID  "PCI:0:2:0"
Not too familiar with the BusID, maybe someone else is here.
would the VGA cable be an issue?
Well, with DVI, the refresh rate doesn't matter (to the best of my knowledge), but as far as the VGA cable being related to the BusID, def. not.
Let me take a peek at my xorg, hold on.
k, thanks.
Someone correct me if I'm wrong, but the BusID shouldn't matter; it depends on the slot. Hmmmm
Did you try changing the refresh rate in your xorg.conf ?
you mean the vsync and horiz rates? yeah
What video card?
Intel Corporation 82945G/GZ Integrated Graphics Controller
Does this happen to be an HP Pavilion?
no...Dell Optiplex
ok, I just googled the chipset and got a few hits back on discussions wrt the same symptoms
really?
so it's the video card and not the LCD?
It looks like xorg settings to me, but you might want to search the forums.
what did you search under google?
either "Ubuntu Gutsy Intel 82945G refresh rate" or "Ubuntu Intel 82945G refresh rate"
sry I couldn't be more help.
np...thanks
